articles.description: Ferrets are pretty cool pets. They‚Äôre friendly, smart, super curious and fun to hang out with!But when it comes to taking care of your new friend, you might be wondering ‚Äî what do ferrets eat?To find out what the best foods are to feed your ferret (and those to avoid), we reached out to Samantha Henson, a certified clinical pet nutritionist with Next Generation Pet Wellness, and Dr. Robert Fillman, a veterinarian at GeoZoo (and ferret parent!).What do ferrets eat?Well, for starters, ferrets are carnivores ‚Äî or more specifically, obligate carnivores. This means that their diet should consist of at least 70 percent meat.‚ÄúMuch like tigers, alligators and snakes, ferrets need meat to survive and cannot turn plant proteins into what their bodies need,‚Äù Henson told The Dodo. ‚ÄúThey thrive on a di‚Ä¶
articles.title: What Can I Feed My Ferret? - The Dodo

articles.description: This will make you want to visit the craft store!Arts and crafts sure can be fun! Mod-podge, construction paper, pipe cleaners, glitter.. heck, why not get your pets in on the action for a little fun creative bonding time?¬†Or, in the case of @Fuffyferrets¬†you can wait until it's naptime and then get creative when your adorable little floofs are sleepy. Just watch this video and umm, we can't, we just can't with this. This is hilarious.¬†View the original article to see embedded media.LOL! We love how mama to these pet ferrets is practically in tears in this video. It's just too funny. @BrittannyCC says "I just made this exact same noise laughing at this omfg." @ShaneMcneill adds "This made my day better thank you for the laugh those ferrets are so cute." @Tommy is as amused as we are "OH MY GOSH I LOST IT!! THE FREAKING GOOGLY EYES!!"¬†So does anyone have some ferrets we can borrow? Not only are they adorable but they just made googly eyes that much more hilarious.¬†Do you have a pet who's funny, smart, full of personality, or just downright adorable? We'd love for you to submit a video of your fur baby for a chance to be featured on PetHelpful and our social channels! Click here to upload your clip and share your beloved pet with the world. For more interesting pet news, be sure to sign up for our newsletter!

articles.description: The Watcher. (L to R) Luke David Blumm as Carter Brannock, Bobby Cannavale as Dean Brannock in episode 102 of The Watcher. Cr. Eric Liebowitz/Netflix ¬© 2022A new mystery-thriller series titled¬†The Watcher is now streaming on Netflix. It follows a family who after moving into their dream home, begins receiving threatening letters from a mysterious stalker called ‚ÄúThe Watcher.‚Äù While watching the series, you might start to have questions. Actually, a question we‚Äôre seeing being asked a lot revolves around a ferret.Spoilers from The Watcher ahead!We‚Äôre introduced to the ferret in episode 1. As the Brannock family moves into the 657 Boulevard house, Carter comes down the stairs carrying his pet ferret named Sprinkles. He asks Dean where the ferret‚Äôs leash is, and Dean replies that he doesn‚Äôt know. Then, Dean tells Carter not to let Sprinkles run all over the house because he doesn‚Äôt want them peeing everywhere.¬†Later in the episode, we find out that Dean and Nora bought Carter the ferret to make him feel comfortable about moving into the new house.Flash forward further into the episode, Sprinkles escapes from their cage and ventures around the house as the Brannocks are asleep. But then the ferret is snatched up by a person with black gloves. So, what happens to Sprinkles? Do they die?Sadly, Sprinkles does die. The next morning, Carter gets up and walks out of his room to find Sprinkles bleeding profusely from their head. Then, the Brannocks call the police to find out who broke into their home and killed Sprinkles. The detective tells them there‚Äôs nothing he can do because there‚Äôs no proof that someone broke in. He continues and says that all the doors were locked, and there were no signs of forced entry. By the end of the season, we never find out who killed Sprinkles.The Watcher is now available to stream on Netflix.Here‚Äôs more content on¬†The Watcher¬†to check out!   Next:¬†5 good Netflix shows this weekend: The Watcher, The Sinner, and more
articles.title: Does the ferret die in The Watcher? - Netflix Life

The internet was in hysterics after a cat brought a ferret friend home to play.Cats are sometimes known to protect their personal space and are wary of anything that interferes with that, but in one instance, a cat appeared to have made friends with a neighborhood ferret and even brought him home for a snack.While ferrets are considered to be social animals - recommended to be kept in pairs - there are several considerations that should be factored in when introducing them to other species.File photo of cat and ferret. A man was shocked when his cat brought home someone else's pet ferret. 
Getty Images/DonnaOchoaPhotography / Irina Vasilevskaia
According to the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Australia (RSPCAA), ferrets are strict carnivores and eat whole animals, in‚Ä¶

articles.description: BILLINGS¬†‚Äî¬†Life in the animal kingdom is tough, and bouncing back from the edge of extinction is even tougher. But that‚Äôs exactly what the black-footed ferret is trying to do with a little help from animal biologists."These animals genetically were down to seven animals. Only seven animals left that were breeding and so to know that their numbers are bouncing back, there‚Äôs about 300-400 out in the wild right now. It‚Äôs a true success story. We released 18 of these incredibly endangered, one of the most endangered animals in North America, back to their natural habitat and it was an amazing experience," said Jeff Ewelt, executive director at ZooMontana.Prior to 1981, most biologists believed the black-footed ferret was extinct, but that all changed one day on the Hog family ranch near Meetee‚Ä¶
articles.title: Black-footed ferrets getting a boost in population recovery in Wyoming - Q2 News

articles.description: BRYAN, Texas (KBTX) - It‚Äôs not every day that veterinarians at the Texas A&M Small Animal Teaching Hospital (SATH) get to sew a pacemaker onto a beating heart roughly the size of a grape!But when Hypnos, a 5-year-old ferret, arrived at the SATH with a very slow heart rate, his veterinary team took on the challenge of helping the beloved pet return home healthy to his owner and ferret friends. This was the first ferret pacemaker procedure at the SATH in almost 10 years.Copyright 2022 KBTX. All rights reserved.
articles.title: Treat of the Day: Ferret received lifesaving pacemaker at Texas A&M - KBTX

articles.description:
Glamour üòé Portrait üì∏
In a world where social media platforms like Instagram and Snapchat reign supreme, it‚Äôs no surprise that people are always looking for new ways to up their selfie game. After all, who doesn‚Äôt love a good selfie? Enter ‚Äúglamour portraits.‚Äù
What is a glamour portrait, you ask? It‚Äôs a portrait that is taken in a more glamourous setting, with the purpose of capturing the subject‚Äôs beauty and radiance. Glamour portraits are all about making the person being photographed look and feel their absolute best.
Now, you might be thinking that you don‚Äôt need a professional photographer to take a glamour portrait of you. And you would be right! With the right pose, lighting, and filter, anyone can take a gorgeous glamour portrait.
Here are a few tips to help you get started:
1. Fi‚Ä¶

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I‚Äôm Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 ‚Ä¶ by I don‚Äôt know about you, but there have been times in my life when I‚Äôve been so tired that I thought I would just wake up and go back to bed. It‚Äôs not uncommon to feel this way after a long day at work or a night out with friends. However, there are times when this feeling can be more intense and last for several days. If you find yourself in this situation, it‚Äôs important to listen to your body and get the rest you need.It can be hard to let go of the things you need to do in order to get some rest, but it‚Äôs important to remember that your health comes first. If you‚Äôre feeling exhausted, try to take a nap or go to bed early. And if you find yourself struggling to stay awake, don‚Äôt be afraid to ask for help. There‚Äôs no shame in admitting that you need some assistance.In short, don‚Äôt push yourself too hard if you‚Äôre feeling tired. Get the rest you need and take care of yourself. Your body will thank you for it.
articles.title: I thought I would wake up, but I went back to bed twice with all my strength

articles.description: A black-footed ferret kit takes its first look at freedom as it transitions from a holding pen to a plateau filled with white-tailed prairie dogs near Meeteetse. Prairie dogs are the main food source for the little mammals.¬†    Mark Davis, Powell Tribune       State wildlife managers gave another boost last week to the black-footed ferret population being reestablished near Meeteetse.The Wyoming Game and Fish Department released 18 captive-born ferrets ‚Äî 12 males and six females ‚Äî into the northwestern part of the state, where the last known black-footed ferrets were discovered in the wild in 1981. Prior to the find, North America‚Äôs only native ferret species was believed to be extinct.After successfully establishing a self-sustaining ferret population in Shirley Basin over the last two-an‚Ä¶
articles.title: Eighteen black-footed ferrets released outside Meeteetse - Casper Star-Tribune

articles.description:
Toast climbed up onto me so I‚Äôd carry him once he got tired
Informal articles are not typically written in English. If you are writing informally in English, it is best to use simple language and sentences. However, if you want to write a formal article in English, it is important to use proper grammar and punctuation. An example of a formal article about toast climbing onto someone to be carried is provided below.
Carrying Toast
Toast loves to be carried around, but he knows that eventually he will tire out his owner. So, when he sees his owner sitting down, he climbs up onto them so they will carry him. This is a cute trick that Toast has learned and it always gets a smiles from his owner.
articles.title: Toast climbed up onto me so I‚Äôd carry him once he got tired

articles.description: Photo courtesy of the Wyoming Game and Fish Department.The Wyoming Game and Fish Department reports 18 black-footed ferrets were released last week on the historic recovery site near Meeteetse. Twelve male and six female captive-born ferrets were coaxed into burrows in their new wildlands home. The small mammal that was once thought to be extinct was rediscovered in Wyoming 41 years ago. Game and Fish has been working on their recovery since then. Game and Fish and U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service released the black-footed ferrets on private land. Partnerships with landowners in Wyoming have been key to the species recovery efforts, according to the department. ‚ÄúThe Lazy BV and Pitchfork ranches are dedicated to black-footed ferrets and their success,‚Äù Game and Fish Nongame Supervisor Zack W‚Ä¶
articles.title: Game and Fish report the release of 18 black-footed ferrets on historic recovery site ‚Äì Sheridan Media - Sheridan Media

articles.description: Eighteen black-footed ferrets were released recently at the animal's historic recovery site near Meeteetse, Wyoming.Twelve male and six female captive-born ferrets were coaxed into burrows in their new wildlands home. The small mammal that was once thought to be extinct was rediscovered in Wyoming 41 years ago. The Wyoming Game and Fish Department has been working on their recovery since then.In 1979, black-footed ferrets were considered extinct. In 1981, a ranch dog discovered a ferret in Meteetse, WY. This led to the discovery of a small population and the first recovery program. Today, the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service and its many partners are leading an effort to take ferrets off the Endangered Species List. This is their story. (Video courtesy of Wyoming Game and Fish Department) ‚Ä¶
articles.title: 18 black-footed ferrets released near Meeteetse - Billings Gazette

articles.description: But people in power have a long history of bending science to fit their political agenda. The latest example, 4 species of bumble ‚Ä¶ OverviewThe debate over whether or not ferrets should be classified as domestic animals has been ongoing for many years, with arguments for and against both sides. Now, however, it appears that the scientific community is largely in agreement that ferrets should, in fact, be classified as domestic animals.The primary argument in favor of classifying ferrets as domestic animals is that they have been domesticated for centuries, and are significantly different from their wild ancestors. Ferrets were first domesticated in Europe over 2,000 years ago, and were brought to the United States in the 1800s. They have been bred in captivity for generations, and their be‚Ä¶
articles.title: Science demands Domestic Ferrets be Classified as Domestic Animals

articles.description: The Wyoming Game and Fish Department released 18 black-footed ferrets on the Meeteetse recovery site. (Wyoming Game and Fish)   CASPER, Wyo. ‚Äî The Wyoming Game and Fish Department released 18 black-footed ferrets on the historic recovery site near Meeteetse last week, the department announced Monday.  The 12 male and six female ferrets born in captivity ‚Äúwere coaxed into burrows in their new wildlands home,‚Äù Game and Fish said. Black-footed ferrets were once thought extinct but were then rediscovered in Wyoming 41 years ago, and Game and Fish and the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service have been working to help the species recover.  Game and Fish released the 18 ferrets in an effort to maintain at least 35 ferrets at the Meeteetse recovery site, a baseline set by the U.S. FWS. The department ob‚Ä¶
articles.title: (PHOTOS) 18 black-footed ferrets released on historic Wyoming recovery site - Oil City News

The 12 male and six female ferrets born in captivity ‚Äúwere coaxed into burrows in their new wildlands home,‚Äù Game and Fish said. Black-footed ferrets were once thought extinct but were then rediscovered in Wyoming 41 years ago, and Game and Fish and the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service have been working to help the species recover.  Game and Fish released the 18 ferrets in an effort to maintain at least 35 ferrets at the Meeteetse recovery site, a baseline set by the U.S. FWS. The department ob‚Ä¶

articles.description:
Oh, hello there
In recent years, the English-speaking world has seen a surge in the use of the phrase ‚Äúoh, hello there‚Äù. While its origins are unknown, it is clear that this phrase has become a part of popular culture.
There are many possible interpretations of the meaning of ‚Äúoh, hello there‚Äù. It can be used as a polite way of acknowledging someone‚Äôs presence, or as a way of showing surprise. It can also be used as a way of initiating conversation, or as a way of showing interest in someone.
Whatever the intention behind it, ‚Äúoh, hello there‚Äù is a phrase that is here to stay. So next time you see someone, why not try out this friendly greeting and see where it takes you?
articles.title: Oh, hello there

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I‚Äôm Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 ‚Ä¶ Falling down the stairs is a hazard that many people face on a daily basis. This can be a particular problem if the stairs are in a public place, such as in a shopping centre or office block. Unfortunately, this is exactly what happened to me last week.I was descending a flight of stairs in my workplace when I suddenly lost my footing and tumbled all the way down, landing in an undignified heap at the bottom. Fortunately, I was not seriously injured, though I did suffer some bruising.This incident has led me to think about the safety of stairs in our society. Surely, there must be a better way to design them so that accidents like mine are less likely to happen? I would like to see a change in the way that stairs are built so that they are safer for everyone.
articles.title: I got battered in the middle of the stairs

articles.description:
My mega-chonker hambeast Kevin. He comes in at 4.3 pounds and is 2 feet long.
In today‚Äôs world, it‚Äôs not uncommon to see massive animals. But Kevin, my mega-chonker hambeast, takes the cake. He comes in at 4.3 pounds and is 2 feet long!
I adopted Kevin 8 months ago from a local shelter. At the time, he was a chonky boy, but he has truly blossomed into a magnificent hambeast. His thick fur is soft and luxurious, and he has the cutest little face.
 Kevin loves to eat, as you might expect. His favorite foods are carrots, apples, and bananas. He also enjoys the occasional ham bone. Kevin is very active and loves to play. He is especially fond of chasing his tail.
As you can see, Kevin is a very special animal. He brings joy to everyone who meets him. I am so lucky to have him in my life!
articles.title: My mega-chonker hambeast Kevin. He comes in at 4.3 pounds and is 2 feet long.

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I‚Äôm Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 ‚Ä¶ We all know the saying, ‚ÄúApril showers bring May flowers.‚Äù But what about the hidden gem of April- the moss! Too often we focus on the flowers and forget about the low-lying foliage that is essential to any garden.As we head into April, now is the time to start thinking about adding some moss to your landscape. Moss is a great way to add texture and interest to your garden. It can also help to control erosion on slopes and in shady areas where grass has a difficult time growing.If you‚Äôre thinking about adding moss to your garden, there are a few things to keep in mind. First, moss does best in cool, moist areas. so, if you live in a hot, dry climate, you may want to consider growing moss in a container instead of in your garden beds. Second, moss is a slow-growing plant, so be patient and be prepared to wait a few months for it to really start filling in.If you‚Äôre looking for a low-maintenance plant that will add a touch of beauty to your garden, consider moss. Just be sure to give it the cool, moist conditions it needs to thrive.
articles.title: Too much frolicking and moss

articles.author: voiceferret

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I‚Äôm Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 ‚Ä¶ If you‚Äôve been waiting to take your computer in for service because you can‚Äôt find a babysitter for your ferret, you‚Äôre in luck. Your wait is almost over.On April 1, Best Buy will begin offering ferret check and pick-up service at all of its stores in the United States. The service, which is free of charge, will allow customers to drop off their computers for service and pick up their ferrets at the same time.According to Best Buy, the new service was created in response to customer feedback. ‚ÄúWe know that our customers love their ferrets, but they also need their computers fixed,‚Äù said a spokesperson for the retailer. ‚ÄúThis new service will make it easier for them to get both done at the same time.‚ÄùTo take advantage of the new service, customers can bring their ferrets to any Best Buy store during regular business hours. A Best Buy employee will then check the ferret for any health concerns and provide a temporary cage for the animal while the customer‚Äôs computer is being serviced.Once the computer is ready, the customer can pick up both the computer and the ferret at the customer service desk. Best Buy says the entire process should take about two hours.So if you‚Äôve been putting off getting your computer fixed because you didn‚Äôt want to leave your furry friend behind, there‚Äôs no need to worry any longer. Best Buy has you covered.
articles.title: Get a ferret check and then pick up your computer

articles.author: The Modern Ferret
articles.description:
Introducing a new segment we're doing called Why Weasel Wednesday where we'll share things from you guys - out in the ferret community! I am looking forward to sharing your beautiful stories, particularly of times when your ferret has gotten you through a challenging time. I think this has the potential to help us all feel more connected and less alone during the ups and downs of life.
This week's is from @kayyy_sea -thank you so much for sharing. I‚Äôd love if people would comment some words of encouragement to her!
We will share another heartwarming story next Wednesday 
(Feed generated with FetchRSS)
articles.title: Photos from The Modern Ferret's post

articles.description:
My croissant ü•ê
My croissant is the best! It‚Äôs fluffy and buttery and just perfect. I could eat it every day.
I‚Äôm not sure what it is about croissants that makes them so special, but they just are. They‚Äôre the perfect breakfast food or snack. And, they‚Äôre so easy to make!
If you‚Äôve never had a croissant, you‚Äôre missing out. But, thankfully, they‚Äôre not hard to find. Most bakeries sell them, and you can even find them in some grocery stores.
So, next time you‚Äôre looking for something special, pick up a croissant. I promise, you won‚Äôt be disappointed.
articles.title: My croissant ü•ê

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: It‚Äôs time for the Ferret Room Tour. It has been so exciting turning my idea into reality. The room is not quite done, there are still ‚Ä¶ I figured out what I wanted in my ferret room and how to get it without spending a fortune. I‚Äôm going to share my ideas with you in hopes it will give you some ideas for your own ferret room. My ferret room is approximately 3m x 5m. I have two large cages, one is 2m x 2m and the other is 1.5m x 2m. I also have a small cage, approximately .6m x .6m, which I use as a hospital cage. My room also has a double door entry, which I find very useful. I‚Äôve outfitted the room with a window unit air conditioner and a space heater. I have a few large fans that I use to circulate the air and I keep the room very clean. The floor is covered with linoleum tile, which is easy to clean and keep sanitary.I built my own cages using PVC pipe and wire mesh. I find that this is the best material to use for cages because it is easy to clean and disinfect. It is also strong and sturdy, which is important when you have large ferrets. I build my own cages because I can make them any size that I want and I can put them wherever I want in the room. I have a total of four ferrets, two males and two females.I‚Äôve furnished the room with liberal amounts of sensory enrichment toys, hammocks, beds, and tunnels. I want my ferrets to be happy and healthy, so I make sure they have plenty of things to do. I also have a large play area that I built using PVC pipe and wire mesh. This is where my ferrets can run and play when I am not able to provide one-on-one play time.My room is very important to me and I have put a lot of thought into it. I hope that this tour has given you some ideas for your own ferret room.
articles.title: Ferret Room Tour: Turning My Ideas into Reality

articles.description:
Just got my first stinky noodle baby after wanting one for years!
Motherhood is a beautiful thing. The moment a woman becomes a mother, her whole life changes. She is no longer just a woman, but a mother. And a mother‚Äôs love is like no other.
So, when a woman finally becomes a mother after years of wanting to be one, it is a very special moment. This was the case for one woman, who got her first ‚Äústinky noodle baby‚Äù after wanting one for years.
The woman, who wishes to remain anonymous, had always wanted to be a mother. But, for one reason or another, it just hadn‚Äôt happened. So, when she finally became a mother, she was over the moon.
And her new baby, who she has lovingly named her ‚Äústinky noodle baby‚Äù, is just perfect. She is everything the woman has ever wanted in a child and more.
The woman is now enjoying every moment with her new baby and is relishing in the fact that she is finally a mother. She is grateful for the moment that she finally got her ‚Äústinky noodle baby‚Äù and is looking forward to all the wonderful moments to come.
articles.title: Just got my first stinky noodle baby after wanting one for years!

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: Ferrets Billy and Gina swimming first time in the ocean.) –•–æ—Ä—å–∫–∏ –ë–∏–ª–ª–∏ –∏ –î–∂–∏–Ω–∞ –≤ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π —Ä–∞–∑ –∫—É–ø–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –≤ –æ–∫–µ–∞–Ω–µ.) On a recent sunny day, my ferrets and I took a trip to the beach. This was their first time swimming in the ocean, and they loved it!After digging holes in the sand and rolling around in the waves, they were ready to take on the big blue. They paddled and splashed around like little puppies, and had a blast chasing the seagulls.It was so much fun to watch them experience the beach for the first time. Their joy and enthusiasm was contagious, and I‚Äôm already looking forward to our next trip.

articles.description:
I‚Äôm watching a friend‚Äôs ferret this week and sending them as many cute photos as I can
As anyone who has ever owned a pet knows, the experience can be immensely rewarding. From the moment you first bring them home, to the silly things they do that always make you laugh, to the unending loyalty they show you, pets can quickly become some of the most important members of the family. This is why, when a friend or family member has to go out of town and can‚Äôt take their furry (or scaly, or feathered) friend with them, it‚Äôs such a kind act to volunteer to petsit.
This week, I am fortunate enough to be taking care of a friend‚Äôs ferret. While I‚Äôve never owned a ferret myself, I have done my research and feel confident in providing the little guy with the care and attention he needs. I‚Äôm also excited to be able to send my friend lots of photos and updates while they‚Äôre away, so they can rest assured that their ferret is in good hands.
There‚Äôs something really special about the bond between humans and their pets, and I‚Äôm grateful to be able to experience it firsthand this week. Taking care of a pet is a responsibility that shouldn‚Äôt be taken lightly, but it‚Äôs also a lot of fun. If you ever have the opportunity to petsit for a friend, I highly recommend it!
articles.title: I‚Äôm watching a friend‚Äôs ferret this week and sending them as many cute photos as I can

articles.author: The Modern Ferret
articles.description:
Hate to break it to you but "ferret proofing" is an endless battle between you and your ferret. That's because these weasels are gifted problem solvers and they see any new barrier as a challenge rather than a limit (maybe that's a lesson we should all take with us in life actually??). I use this ferret gate to keep my ferret restricted to his room (my office). It's especially useful when he's on a plant-digging rampage or I need to contain him while I clean the other rooms of the house. Try as he might, he has not been able to climb over it! Have you guys used anything similar?
If you need something like this, you can check it out in my Amazon shop, linked in my bio!(Feed generated with FetchRSS)
articles.title: Hate to break it to you but "ferret proofing" is an endless battle between you and your ferret. That's because these weasels are...

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: Should we have pets? What kind of life should our pets expect from us? This is what I have been asking myself recently and I ‚Ä¶ A recent study has shown that owning a pet can have numerous benefits for humans, including reducing stress, anxiety and depression, and even increasing our lifespan. But what about the pets themselves? What is life like for them? In this article, we take a look at the lives of three different types of pet ‚Äì a fish, two birds and a ferret.FishOf the three pets, fish have the shortest lifespan, with most only living for a few years. However, this doesn‚Äôt mean that their life is any less full or interesting.Many fish are social creatures and enjoy living in groups. This means they have the opportunity to interact with other members of their species on a daily basis, something that can be very stimulating and enjoyable.Fish also have a great sense of hearing and smell, and some can even see in ultraviolet light. This means they are able to take in and process a lot of information about their surroundings.BirdsBirds have a much longer lifespan than fish, with some species living for over 50 years. This means they have a lot of time to experience different aspects of life.For example, birds can fly, something that most other animals can‚Äôt do. This gives them a completely different perspective on the world and allows them to travel vast distances.Birds also have very good eyesight, which means they can see a wide range of colours and patterns. This can be particularly stunning when they are flying over vast landscapes or sunsets.FerretsFerrets are a type of small mammal that is closely related to the weasel. They have a lifespan of around 6-8 years.Ferrets are very active animals and love to play. This means they need a lot of space to run around in and plenty of toys to keep them entertained.Ferrets are also very social creatures and enjoy being around people and other animals. They are often very playful and can be very mischievous!
articles.title: A Pet's Life: One Fish, Two Birds and a Ferret

articles.author: The Modern Ferret
articles.description:
Time for a Fun Ferret Fact!:
The English word ‚Äòferret‚Äô is derived from the latin word for ‚Äòthief‚Äô, furonem. If you are new to ferrets, it is worth mentioning that ferrets are notorious for stealing and stashing just about everything (pens, keys, phone, charger, wallet, your heart..) so the name is quite fitting to their nature. What is a ferret? In short, they are thieves!
The full scientific name for a ferret is Mustela putorius furo. In latin, this translates to ‚Äústinky mouse-killing thief‚Äù.
Do you think this description is accurate or too harsh?(Feed generated with FetchRSS)

articles.title: Kelpie, 6 years old and she‚Äôs still the tiniest zoom machine I‚Äôve ever known.

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I came to my feet, hugged them, and fell asleep. Wow! ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì I hugged the ferret and started sleeping as it was already midnight. I had been studying for my finals and was exhausted. The ferret, who I had named ¬´Midnight¬ª, was a soft and cuddly creature that always made me feel better. I do not know why I was so attached to this animal, but I could not help but feel guilty when I had to let it go.When I found out that my family was moving and that we could not take Midnight with us, I was heartbroken. I did not want to let the ferret go, but I knew that it was for the best. I wanted her to have a good home and be loved, even if it was not by me.I found a good home for Midnight and said my goodbyes. It was one of the hardest things I have ever had to do, but I knew that it was for the best. I will never forget the times we had together and I will always remember her fondly.
articles.title: I hugged the ferret and started sleeping as it was‚Ä¶

articles.description: Recently, Cody Rinehart was on a walk in the woods near his home in Ohio when he saw an unfamiliar creature just ahead in the middle of the trail.TikTok/caching_with_codyAt first, Rinehart thought the animal might be a possum. But unlike most wild animals, the little guy wasn‚Äôt scared of Rinehart. In fact, he happily scurried over to examine Rhinehart‚Äôs boots.As the animal got closer, Rinehart was shocked to realize that he‚Äôd stumbled across a pet ferret, all alone in the woods.Dodo ShowsOdd CouplesDog Is So Gentle And Patient With Her Foster KittensTikTok/caching_with_codyRinehart scooped up the sweet ferret and took him to an animal hospital. A vet confirmed the ferret was in good health, aside from some ticks and dehydration, and estimated that he had been living in the woods for a few days.Rinehart came to the heartbreaking conclusion that the ferret was likely abandoned, as the nature preserve where he found him was miles from the nearest town. Plus, the friendly ferret loved being around people, and quickly made himself comfortable in Rinehart‚Äôs home.‚ÄúHe's adapted pretty well, which is what really leads me to think he was definitely abandoned and not a runaway,‚Äù Rinehart told The Dodo. ‚ÄúHe loves people and doesn't really let me out of his sight. He's been super friendly, even when I first found him.‚ÄùRinehart named his new pet Noodle and bought him everything he needed to be happy and comfortable.Noodle quickly became pals with Rinehart‚Äôs cats, Rue and Jalapeno, and the three of them now often play together around the house.‚ÄúIf [Noodle is] not out chasing Jalapeno, he's snoozing in his hammock and living the good life,‚Äù Rinehart said.Noodle also enjoys putting on his harness for short walks outside in the yard and eating lots of freeze-dried treats.Thanks to the kindness of his new dad, Noodle has everything he needs, and he‚Äôll never have to worry about being left alone again.You can keep up with Noodle and Rinehart on TikTok and YouTube.
articles.title: Lost Little Animal Approaches Guy In The Woods And Asks Him To Take Him Home - The Dodo

articles.description:
More like me trying to keep her out of the kitchen cabinets
It‚Äôs no secret that toddlers love to explore. Every parent has likely gone through the phase of child-proofing their home to prevent their little one from getting into everything. But what do you do when your toddler is hell-bent on getting into the kitchen cabinets?
If you‚Äôre like me, you‚Äôve probably tried everything from keeping the doors shut to putting locks on them. But no matter what we do, our toddler always seems to find a way to get into the cabinets. The other day, I even found her standing on a stool trying to reach the top shelves!
At this point, you might be wondering why we even bother keeping the cabinets shut in the first place. After all, what‚Äôs the worst that could happen?
Well, for starters, toddlers can be very curious and once they get into something, they might not be able to get back out. This could lead to them getting stuck, or worse, injuring themselves.
There have also been cases of toddlers getting into poisonous substances that were stored in cabinets. Ingesting even a small amount of some chemicals can be deadly for a child.
So, what‚Äôs a parent to do?
For starters, we can try to keep things out of reach. This might mean moving cleaning supplies and other dangerous items to higher shelves. We can also try to child-proof the cabinets with locks or covers.
Ultimately, though, it‚Äôs important to remember that toddlers are curious by nature and no amount of child-proofing will completely prevent them from getting into the cabinets. So, it‚Äôs important to be vigilant and always keep an eye on our little ones, even when we‚Äôre in another room.
articles.title: More like me trying to keep her out of the kitchen cabinets

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: „ÄêFerret Introduction„Äë Choco ‚ôÄBorn on April 30, 2018 Name (Chi-chan, Chitaro, Hime) Cookie‚ôÇBorn on November 15, 2021 ‚Ä¶ A ferret falls asleep while being intensity shot by its owner in this heartwarming video.In the video, the ferret can be seen lying on its back with its eyes closed while its owner shoots it with a stream of water from a hose.Despite the ferret‚Äôs relaxed state, the owner continues to shoot it with the hose, making sure to get every part of the ferret‚Äôs body.The ferret doesn‚Äôt seem to mind the intense shooting and actually seems to be enjoying it, as evidenced by its cute sleepy expressions.This video is sure to put a smile on your face and is a perfect example of the bond between a human and their pet.
articles.title: „ÄêGot Hand„ÄëIntense shooting of the moment when the ferret falls asleep! „Äêferret#1035„Äë

My Ferret Badger
My ferret badger is the best pet I have ever had! She is so playful and loves to cuddle. I have had her for two years and she has never once made a mess in my house. She is the perfect pet for anyone who wants a low-maintenance, loving companion.
